articles.title: Australia, New Zealand dollars hit new 2025 highs amid more US tariff chaos
articles.content: The Australian and NewZealand dollars hit new 2025 highs on Monday after U.S.President Donald Trump's fresh tariff threats undermined thegreenback, while a rebound in global stocks also aided...

articles.title: Shares in China-listed Apple suppliers fall after Trump's tariff threats
Major China-listed Apple suppliers including Luxshare, Goertek fall after Trump's tariff threats
articles.content: SHANGHAI ) -Major China-listed Apple suppliers including Luxshare, Goertek and Lens Tech opened sharply lower on Monday after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened tariffs on imported iPhones. ...

articles.title: Buying Apple Stock Isn't Worth the Risk
articles.content: The iPhone business is already flatlining, and a lucrative $20 billion deal with Google could go up in smoke.  Apple's valuation is lofty and may not reflect the risks facing the company.  In a post on Truth Social, Trump threatened a tariff of at least 25% on all iPhones manufactured outside of the United States.

articles.title: Apple Boosts iPhone Trade-In Discounts in China to Reignite Lagging Sales
articles.content: On Friday, Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) announced that the company is now offering additional trade-in discounts for new iPhones in China until June 18, 2025. This initiative aims to stimulate demand in a crucial market where the company has faced increasing competition and declining sales. Apple has increased the trade-in value for old iPhones. For instance, […]

articles.title: Warning To U.S. Stock Investors Issued By CDS Markets
articles.content: US CDS spreads suggest US debt is riskier than official ratings indicate, while equities remain complacent. Learn why the risk-reward in US stocks is poor now.

articles.title: Despite Trump's Warning To Tim Cook, Apple Moves Ahead With $1.5 Billion India Expansion Via Foxconn To Boost iPhone Production: Report
articles.content: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) is reportedly pushing forward with a major supply chain expansion in India through its top manufacturing partner, Foxconn, also known as Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. Ltd. (OTC:HNHAF). What Happened: Foxconn plans to invest $1.5 billion in a new display module plant near Chennai, India, reported the Financial Times, citing two government officials. The facility will assemble screen components for iPhones, including the touch interface and brightness control. Foxconn on
